properties.title: TI, GYLA, Association Law and Justice, ISFED Issue Joint Statement on Participation of Military Servicemen
properties.description:
TI, GYLA, Association Law and Justice, ISFED Issue Joint Statement on Participation of Military ServicemenAccording to Article 10.10(1) of the Georgian Electoral Code, the servicemen of the Defense Ministry’s and Interior Ministry’s military (paramilitary) forces and units are to participate both in the proportional and the majoritarian vote in the local elections if by the Election Day they are permanently deployed at one place for a year or more.
The amendment was added to the Electoral Code on 28 December 2009 following a recommendation made by NGOs. Previously, these individuals could vote in the proportional and majoritarian elections without any restrictions: they could elect local government bodies and officials even if their place of deployment had changed only a few days before the elections. The NGOs recommended that only the individuals who have served in the relevant electoral district for at least a year should be allowed to vote.
This recommendation aimed at ensuring that no military servicemen would be relocated shortly before the elections in order to influence the outcome of vote in specific electoral district(s). However, the Central Electoral Commission (CEC) and the ruling party representatives presently interpret Article 10.10(1) in a different way. According to them, all military servicemen who have signed, at any point prior to the compilation of the special voter list, 1 a contract for a period of at least one year should be allowed to vote, even if this was done the day before the list was compiled.
This interpretation of Article 10.10(1) contradicts the essence of the recommendation of NGOs and leaves the same situation that existed before the addition of Paragraph 10(1) to the law. Read more at: http://isfed.ge/pdf/ngo_joint_press_conference_military_voting_eng_27.05.pdfTime: 2010-05-30 10:10:33Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Mtatsminda

properties.title: Member of Christian Democrats Verbally Assaults Journalist
properties.description: Member of Christian Democrats Verbally Assaults JournalistOn May 14, in # 14 Dedoplitskaro election district, David Alugashvili, the member of „Christian- Democratic Movement” verbally insulted Ilia Martkophishvili, journalist. The journalist submitted the complaint on physical assault. According to the representative of “Christian-Democratic Movement” he reacted upon the journalist’s dissemination of unsubstantiated information via internet. The local police opened a criminal investigation (Article 154 of the Criminal Code of Georgia) on interfering with conducting of the journalistic professional activities, though it did not proceed as the instance of physical assault could not be confirmed. ISFED’s Long Term Observer witnessed this incident. Read more at: http://isfed.ge/pdf/isfed_lection_update_IV_eng.pdfTime: 2010-05-30 09:33:08Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Dedoplistskaro

properties.title: PEC Chairman Violates Election Code
properties.description: PEC Chairman Violates Election CodeIn # 58 Tskaltubo election district the Republican Party contacted ISFED’s Long Term Observer and informed that on the premises of # 50 Chuneshi election precinct the headquarters of “United National Movement” is located. After the discovery of the fact the party left the building. The representative of ISFED visited the election precinct (on 17:30) and requested the Chairman of the Precinct Election Commission to show the registration journal. The Chairman told that the journal was not at the election precinct as the secretary of the commission to it home. ISFED considers that by doing so the secretary of the precinct election commission violated his/her duties. Herewith, it is evident that the Chairman of the Precinct Election Commission did not properly fulfill his duties and the administrative sections should be applied to him according to Paragraph 1 of Article 371 and Paragraph 4 of Article 39 of the Elections Code of Georgia. As, Sub-paragraph “A” of Paragraph 1 of Article 39 and Sub-paragraph “D” of Paragraph 1 of Article 39 of the Elections Code of Georgia, a Chairman of Precinct Election Commission has full administrative responsibility at the district election commission and he personally is responsible for keeping the election documentation, including the registration journal.Time: 2010-05-30 09:05:27Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: TskaltuboPrecinct: 50

properties.title: Election Staff Fired For Verbally Assaulting Journalist
properties.description: Election Staff Fired For Verbally Assaulting JournalistIn # 12 Gurjaani election district, the employee of Gamgeoba of local Municipality Tamaz Abramishvili (on leave) and the representative of Gurjaani election staff of “United National Movement” was fired for interfering with journalist’s professional activities. Abramishvili, interfered illegally with the professional activities of Tamar Kviriashvili, the Correspondent of Kakheti Information Center. The journalist was filming the public servants leaving the premises of the headquarters of “United National Movement” who are not on leave, when Abramishvili verbally assaulted and attempted to abuse physically her. The journalist was forced to leave the territory of the headquarters. According to her “she managed to film Lela Javakhishvili, Acting Head of the Staff of Gamgeoba, leaving the headquarters of “United National Movement”. Also near the headquarters there were parked the cars belonging to the state organization and still used by the candidates. When they saw that I filmed all these facts, I was not allowed to continue filming”. ISFED’s Long Term Observer met with Kakha Mosulishvili, the Chairman of staff of “United National Movement”, who confirmed the fact of incident and said it was caused by personal motives. Gela Mtivlishvili (the Head of Information Center) denies the existence of any personal motives, as the journalist does not have any relations with Abramishvili. http://isfed.ge/pdf/isfed_lection_update_IV_eng.pdfTime: 2010-05-30 08:43:26Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Gurjaani

properties.title: Head of Election Staff
properties.description: Head of Election StaffOn May 14, Nazi Salukvadze, the Head of the Election Staff of the National Council in the village  of Melekeduri in Ozurgeti District, addressed the # 60 Ozurgeti Election District Commission with a statement. According to Salukvadze, the Acting Gamgebeli of Ozurgeti Municipality, Mamia Baramidze, intimidated her in a telephone conversation. Besides the statement, Salukvadze submitted a recording of the above-mentioned telephone conversation, with the fact of intimidation. After the deliberation the District Election Commission announced that if they would have the confirmed facts, they would react. ISFED believes that Ozurgeti District Election did not properly investigate the above-mentioned fact and adopted biased decision. properties.title: Violence Committed Against Members of Opposition
properties.description:
Violence Committed Against Members of OppositionOn 4 May 2010, regional media reported that acts of violence had been committed against members of opposition political parties in Mestia on 3 May. According to eyewitnesses, Samegrelo-Zemo Svaneti Governor Zaza Gorozia, regional police chief Tengiz Gunava, Mestia police chief Giorgi Shedania, his deputy Joni Belkania, Interior Ministry high-ranking officer Anzor Margiani, Mestia majoritarian MP Kandid (Kakha) Kvitsiani and Mestia administration chief Gocha Chelidze were involved in the incident.
Representatives of the Georgian Young Lawyers Association and Transparency International Georgia travelled to Mestia on 14 May and spoke to eyewitnesses and members of opposition political parties in order to verify the information.
They confirmed that dozens of armed people and vehicles of law enforcement bodies were deployed outside the Mestia administration building at 11 p.m. on 3 May, which is also evident in a video footage recorded by one of the eyewitnesses (see video at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N4WXoD4pB7w). Candidates of the Freedom political movement were forcibly taken to the administration building before 3 a.m. and were forced to sign statements of withdrawal from the elections that had been drafted in advance.
Four candidates signed the withdrawal statements, while another four refused.Read more at: http://isfed.ge/pdf/mestia_incident_20.05_eng.pdfTime: 2010-05-30 07:52:59Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Mestia

properties.description: Public Servant Promotes UNMGogona Shavadze, the member of # 29 Precinct Election Commission (appointed by the District Election Commission) who also is the accountant of the public school and a delivery person for the pensions and assistance (public servant) during delivering the pensions and assistance conduct the verbal agitation in favor of “United National Movement”. According to the sub-paragraph “A” and “T” of paragraph 5 of article 73 of the Election Code of Georgia the following persons can not engage in the pre-election agitation: 1) the members of election administration; 2) public servants of the state and local self-governmental bodies, when they directly exercise their duties. properties.title: Voters Intimidated
properties.description:
Voters IntimidatedAccording to the information provided by ISFED’s long term observers, the village proxy at # 46 Lentekhi election district is putting pressure on the voters below the poverty line (village Djakhunderi). Particularly, voters are intimidated that if “United National Movement” would not to win the elections they will lose the social assistance. Such fact was observed in # 84 Khulo election district (Vashlovani community) where Minur Abuladze, the chief of election headquarters of “United National Movement”, who also is the Chaiperson of Adjara Representation of Social Service Agency of Georgia), intimidates the voters of Vashlovani community during the 10
individual meetings that they will lose the social assistance if they would not vote for the “United National Movement”. Read more at: http://isfed.ge/pdf/isfed_election_update_III_eng.pdfTime: 2010-05-30 02:14:28Source: ISFEDCategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Lentekhi

properties.title: Hall Blocked for Expert Group
properties.description: Hall Blocked for Expert GroupIn the Ozurgeti election district, an independent experts’ group coming from Tbilisi faced  problems regarding the renting of the place in cinema “Ozurgeti”. They asked for an assistance to the project coordinator of Transparency International Georgia – Shorena Ghlonti and local journalists, who addressed to the director of the cinema for renting the hall on April 13. Director of the cinema, Levan Mgeladze refused to rent the hall to the above mentioned experts’ group. He explained his decision, that the hall and building were in bad shape and accordingly he did not have a right to rent the hall. It is notable, that # 6 PEC is located in this cinema; In addition, on April 16, in the same building youth group of the “United National Movement” held a closed meeting with the young citizens of Ozurgeti Municipality. properties.title: Intimidation Complaint in Lanchkuti
properties.description:
Intimidation Complaint in LanchkutiAccording to the head of Lanchkhuti organization of “Our Georgia – Free Democrats”, a member of their party and majoritarian candidate of Alliance for Georgia in Nigvziani community, Avtandil Surmanidze was pressured. Avtandil Surmanidze confirmed the noted fact in conversation with GYLA monitor and declared that on April 7, he was summoned at local department of Lanchkhuti Security service. As Surmanidze states, security officer Ckheidze also attended the meeting along with another person who was presented as “boss” from Kutaisi.
These persons suggested Surmanidze “not to complicate matters with them” and adviced him against participation in elections through the party list of Alliance for Georgia. Additionally, Surmanidze who is currently deputy state representative in Nigvziani community was summoned by Lanckkhuti Gamgebeli Giorgi Goguadze, who suggested him to quit. Read more at: http://www.gyla.ge/attachments/712_GYLA%20shualeduri%20I%20ENG%2023.04.10.pdf.Time: 2010-05-29 22:40:40Source: GYLACategory: Complaints - Pre-electionDistrict: Lanchkhuti

properties.title: Pre-Election Environment Monitoring Report

Adjara, Guria, Imereti, Shida Kartli, Kvemo Kartli, Kakheti, Mtskheta-Mtianeti and Tbilisi. Totally, the monitoring is carried out in the capital and 36 municipalities of the country.
